channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Wood Green stabbing: Man charged with social worker attack
item.description: Sulai Bukhari is charged with attempted murder after the man and two police officers were attacked.

item.title: Same-sex parents battle for inclusive paperwork for baby
item.description: Kate and Gemma Fox have encountered numerous forms they cannot fill in since the birth of their son.

item.title: A-level results: Students have been treated fairly - watchdog
item.description: The head of the exams regulator defends the system for deciding grades ahead of A-level and GCSE results day.

item.title: New 'Banksy' artwork appears at Great Yarmouth model village
item.description: A new model, apparently signed by the artist, is found at a Great Yarmouth attraction.

item.title: Leicestershire death: Murder arrest after woman's body found
item.description: A man, 29, is arrested on suspicion of murdering the woman who was found near Woodhouse Eaves.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: Kent footballer alleges player hurled homophobic abuse during game
item.description: Sheppey United's Jahmal Howlett-Mundle says a Tower Hamlets player made a comment during a match.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB match London 2012 with 65 medals won as Kenny and Price take gold
item.description: Cyclist Jason Kenny's keirin triumph plus boxing gold for Lauren Price mean Team GB's Tokyo Olympics medal haul of 65 matches London 2012's total.

item.title: Kent coast sewage leak warning area extended to Herne Bay
item.description: The council says the advice will not be lifted until it is "completely satisfied the sea is safe".

item.title: Heart surgery waits in England may rise by 40%, warns charity
item.description: Even before Covid, waits for heart treatment were far too long, the British Heart Foundation says.

item.title: Spennylympics: Couple complete 102 Olympic events to raise £110,000
item.description: Charlotte Nichols and Stuart Bates raise more than £110,000 during their 17-day challenge.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Chorley friendship group made me smile again, says widower
item.description: Gerald says he felt lonely but has "never looked back" since joining a Chorley friendship group.

item.title: How golf helped a Holocaust survivor
item.description: The club was set up for Jewish people to enjoy golf and is about to celebrate its 90th anniversary.

item.title: Covid in Bradford: 'I just want to see mum and dad one last time'
item.description: Young people in Bradford share their intense experiences of the Covid pandemic in an inner city.

item.title: Covid: Man, 23, 'thought body could brush off virus'
item.description: Patients at the Royal Liverpool Hospital tell BBC North West Tonight about being ill with Covid.

item.title: Joe Willock: Newcastle agree deal to sign Arsenal midfielder for more than £20m
item.description: Newcastle agree a fee with Arsenal in excess of £20m to sign midfielder Joe Willock.

item.title: Premier League: Bucket collections & spaghetti on toast - Brentford's rise through those who lived it
item.description: As Brentford prepare for their first top-flight season since 1947, BBC Sport looks back at their unlikely journey to join England's elite.

item.title: The Hundred: Jason Roy inspires Oval Invincibles to victory over Trent Rockets
item.description: Jason Roy thrills the home crowd to inspire Oval Invincibles to a nine-run victory over top-of-the-table Trent Rockets in a rain-shortened men's Hundred match.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jason Kenny wins seventh gold but Laura Kenny reign as omnium champion over
item.description: Jason Kenny becomes the first Briton to win seven Olympic golds by defending his keirin title - but wife Laura's reign as women's omnium champion has ended.
